summary: The Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) reimburses states for most Medicaid costs—health care costs and administrative costs, such as IT. CMS reimbursed states $34.3 billion for Medicaid IT systems in FY 2008-18. The documentation of CMS's reviews for most IT funding requests 2016-2018 lacked information, indicating that reviews may not have been complete. CMS is supposed to oversee states' use of funds. But...
title: Medicaid Information Technology: Effective CMS Oversight and States' Sharing of Claims Processing and Information Retrieval Systems Can Reduce Costs
